intro: Hemerocallis undulata, commonly known as the wavy leaved daylily, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Asia. It features sword-shaped, wavy-edged leaves that are typically bright green and grow in dense clumps. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom in early summer. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Hemerocallis undulata is also known for its ability to naturalize and spread through rhizomes, creating vibrant clusters over time.
